posts.title: Quiz: Which Oversized Kid-Lit Animal Are You?
posts.text: Find out which beloved kid-lit beast matches your personality!

posts.title: Famed Documentarian Frederick Wiseman Turns His Camera on NYPL in Ex Libris
posts.text: Master documentarian Frederick Wiseman, known for his spellbinding films about complex topics and institutions, turns his attention to The New York Public Library for his latest film, Ex Libris - The New York Public Library.

posts.title: NYPL #FridayReads: The Semi-Pro Edition September 1, 2017
posts.text: During the week, it can be tough to stay on top of everything. On Fridays, though, we suggest kicking back to catch up on all the delightful literary reading the internet has to offer.

posts.title: NYPL Events: What's Happening 9/4-9/18
posts.text: Welcome to our biweekly update on events happening during the next two weeks at The New York Public Library. With 92 locations across New York City, a lot is happening at the Library.

posts.title: All the Authors, Thinkers, and Artists Coming to LIVE from the NYPL This Year
posts.text: The New York Public Library’s premiere conversation series is back, and our fall lineup of guests ranges from luminary authors like Salman Rushdie and Tony Kushner to influential thinkers like Muhammad Yunus and Van Jones.

posts.title: Announcing Our Summer Reading Essay Contest Winners
posts.text: Of the more than 150 essays received, four grand prize winners were chosen to take a bow on the field at Yankee Stadium, meet a player, and and stick around to watch the game with their families.

posts.title: Quiz: How Well Do You Know Your Historical Poems?
posts.text: Can you guess the historical figure or event referenced in these poems? It's harder than you think!

posts.title: Announcing the 2017 Young Lions Fiction Award Finalists
posts.text: We're pleased to announce the finalists for the seventeenth annual Young Lions Fiction Award, honoring the works of five commanding, diverse, young authors. From high-concept premises, to the exploration of heartbreaking family dynamics, each of these debut novels exemplifies the power of the written word.

posts.title: Disney Classics in the Digital Collections
posts.text: While the illustrators each gave the stories their own artistic spin, we spotted some traces of the Disney characters we know and love in the past.

posts.title: #LiteraryMarchMadness 2017: Which Book Will Win?
posts.text: Welcome to our Fourth Annual Literary March Madness (#LiteraryMarchMadness)! This is a bracket-style tournament like the NCAA March Madness basketball tournament, but with a literary twist: our competition pits beloved books against each other and the winner is decided by you!

posts.title: 12 #LibraryShelfie Photos We Loved
posts.text: On the fourth Wednesday of January each year, libraries and readers across social media share selfies with bookshelves and tag them #LibraryShelfie!

posts.title: #ReadersUnite to Share the Books They're Reading
posts.text: This week, readers and writers are celebrating reading by posting the books they're reading to social media, joined together with the hashtag #ReadersUnite.

posts.title: NYPL's Most Popular Checkouts of 2016
posts.text: Over 25 million items are circulated through our network of libraries each year, and among those items there are both expected front-runners and a few interesting surprises every year. For your perusal, we've compiled lists of the top books checked out systemwide and in The Bronx, Manhattan, and Staten Island in 2016.

posts.title: World AIDS Day: A Look in Our Collections
posts.text: World AIDS Day is held on December 1 each year and is an opportunity for people worldwide to unite in the fight against HIV, show their support for people living with HIV and to commemorate those who have died. World AIDS Day was the first ever global health day, held for the first time in 1988.

posts.title: #GivingTuesday: Dedicate a NYPL Bookplate
posts.text: It's #GivingTuesday—the time of year we give back to the causes we are most passionate about. Donate $50 or more today, and give your loved one the unique gift of having his or her name placed in a brand new book entering the Library's circulation across NYC!

posts.title: What Eliza Hamilton Left Behind
posts.text: By now everyone knows that Eliza Hamilton, the wife of Alexander Hamilton, burned her husband's love letters before she died--and November 9th will be the 162nd anniversary of her death on that day in 1854 at the age of 97. But if you're an astute historian, you might notice that Alexander Hamilton was killed in that famous duel way back in 1804.

posts.title: Carve Your Own NYPL Pumpkin for Halloween
posts.text: Happy Halloween! We carved a pumpkin worthy of the Library - and you can, too.

posts.title: It’s Sweater Weather in Our Digital Collections
posts.text: Leaves are changing color, the air smells crisp and clean, pumpkin spice everything is back in stores, and sweater weather is here at last! If you’re looking for some fashion or knitting inspiration, the Digital Collections delivers some amazing designs from the 19th century.

posts.title: Quiz: Which Of These Are Not Stephen King Novels?
posts.text: Stephen King has published over 50 novels since 1974. How well do you know his extensive list of books? See if you can spot the fake titles in this quiz.

posts.title: Celebrate Library Card Sign-Up Month with NYPL
posts.text: September is Library Card Sign-Up Month! It couldn't be easier to get your free NYPL library card and take advantage of all the amazing resources it provides.

posts.title: A Bottle in a Cosmic Ocean: Listen to the Music of The Golden Record
posts.text: On September 5, 1977, a tiny planet called Earth launched the Voyager 1 into the cosmos. To celebrate the anniversary of this hopeful project, here’s a guide to all of the music included on The Golden Record.

posts.title: 5 Books for People Who Love the Internet
posts.text: As an homage to 25 years of Internet life, I’ve pulled a few books in which characters rely on the Internet, for better or worse, and two in Internet-less near-future worlds.

posts.title: 1800s Astronomical Drawings vs. NASA Images
posts.text: Comparing astrological drawings from our Digital Collections to NASA images—how similar do you think they are?

posts.title: #CamerasAndDancers Visits the Library for the Performing Arts
posts.text: With the social media initiative #CamerasAndDancers, Jacob Jonas seeks to encourage collaboration and exploration through the mediums of dance and photography, to help shine a new light on the world of dance.

posts.title: 11 Harry Potter Quotes to Take You Back to Hogwarts
posts.text: In the spirit of revisiting the magical world of Hogwarts, where I learned so many valuable lessons growing up and continue to find that feeling of home upon re-reading, I’ve rounded up some of my favorite inspiring quotes from the Harry Potter series.

posts.title: Catching 'Em All at NYPL with Pokémon GO
posts.text: Pokémon GO brings childhood dreams to life while also showcasing some of the interesting and beautiful items around NYPL.

posts.title: 12 One Sentence Library Stories We Love
posts.text: We've been asking New Yorkers to tell us in one sentence why they love the library or how it has impacted their life—and 2,000 New Yorkers have already written sentences!

posts.title: Quiz: Can You Define These Obscure Words?
posts.text: On April 14 in 1818, the first edition of Noah Webster's An American Dictionary of the English Language was published. To celebrate, we're challenging you to show off your knowledge of obscure definitions with this fun quiz.

posts.title: NYPL's 2016 Finalists for the NYC Neighborhood Library Awards
posts.text: Four of our branches (Aguilar, Fort Washington, Inwood, and Morrisania) have been selected from hundreds of libraries in the city as finalists for the NYC Neighborhood Library Awards. The prizes, given out by a panel of judges, will be announced in June.

posts.title: Why We Love Beverly Cleary
posts.text: Beverly Cleary turns 100 today, and to celebrate we asked some of our library staff to tell us why they love her. We picked a few of our favorite answers to share with you.

posts.title: Celebrate National Library Week
posts.text: It's National Library Week! The American Library Association encourages everyone to help spread the library love.

posts.title: Neil Gaiman on Women Writers Who Inspired Him
posts.text: In the wake of Guy Talese saying he could name no women writers who had inspired him, author Neil Gaiman tweeted out a long list of women writers who have inspired his writing.

posts.title: NYPL Live Q&A with Marley Dias of #1000BlackGirlBooks
posts.text: Join us Friday, March 25, at 1 PM Eastern for a live Twitter and Facebook chat with #1000BlackGirlBooks founder Marley Dias and the NYPL Recommends team.

posts.title: #LiteraryMarchMadness 2016
posts.text: Starting March 17, we'll be holding our Third Annual Literary March Madness! This is a bracket-style tournament like the NCAA March Madness basketball tournament, but with a literary twist: our competition pits famous authors against each other and the winner is decided by you! Sixteen authors will enter, only one can be crowned this year's crowd favorite.

posts.title: In Memoriam: David Bowie's Top 100 Favorite Books
posts.text: Though one of his songs is titled "I Can't Read", David Bowie was actually quite the voracious reader.

posts.title: NYPL's Most Popular Check Outs of 2015
posts.text: Over 20 million items are circulated through our network of 92 libraries each year, and among those items there are both expected front-runners and a few interesting surprises every year. We've compiled lists of the top books checked out systemwide and in The Bronx, Manhattan, and Staten Island in 2015.

posts.title: Library Stories: "Destined to be a Librarian"
posts.text: "Other kids played school and house and all of those things. I played library." - Dawn Collins (Zimmerer)

posts.title: Chocolate Lovers, Rejoice: National Brownie Day Is Here
posts.text: If you were looking for an excuse to eat copious amounts of chocolate today, it’s National Brownie Day! Find books at the library that will satisfy any brownie lover.

posts.title: Make DIY Gift Tags with NYPL Digital Collections
posts.text: Looking to add a colorful, personalized touch to your gifts this year? Look no further than our Digital Collections!

posts.title: #GivingTuesday: Dedicate a NYPL Bookplate
posts.text: Want to give back for #GivingTuesday and honor someone in your life who loves books and learning? We’ve got the perfect thing for you: until December 4, we’re offering custom bookplates that will put your loved one’s name into a library book!

posts.title: Announcing the Five Library Lions Honorees of 2015
posts.text: On November 2, we will be recognizing five outstanding individuals for their achievements in the fields of art, culture, scholarship, and letters by naming them Library Lions at The New York Public Library's annual Library Lions gala.

posts.title: 15 Writers on Writing
posts.text: Whether you’re writing the next War and Peace or just trying to think up the Next Great Tweet, here are a few writers’ quotes on writing to get you through it:

posts.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show Visits NYPL
posts.text: Our Readers & Writers Shop in the Stephen A. Schwarzman Building recently welcomed a new employee for a day: Kevin the Cashier, from The Ellen DeGeneres Show!

posts.title: Show Us Your #LibraryCardSelfie!
posts.text: Continuing our Library Card Sign-Up Month celebration this September, we’re asking you to share your best #LibraryCardSelfie with us!
